summary: This is the last will and testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, executed on November 18, 2014. It designates executors for his estate, bequeaths all his property to the trustees of 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2014 Trust', and outlines extensive powers granted to the executors. The document is significant as it establishes the posthumous control and distribution of Epstein's assets.

locations: Little St. James Island, St. Thomas, United States Virgin Islands
Territory of the United States Virgin Islands, Division of St. Thomas and St. John
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's will, dated November 18, 2014, leaves all his property to the trustees of 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2014 Trust'.
The primary executors named are Darren K. Indyke, David Mitchell, and James E. Staley, with Lawrence H. Summers as a successor executor.
Executors are granted extremely broad powers to manage, invest, sell, and litigate regarding the estate's assets without needing judicial approval.
The will includes a 'no-contest' clause, disinheriting any beneficiary who challenges the will or the trust.
The signatures of two witnesses are present but their names appear to be partially redacted or illegible in the provided text.
